text: The Sahā Triad (娑婆三聖, pinyin: suōpó sānshèng) is a devotional motif in East Asian Buddhist art. It represents the chief Buddha and bodhisattvas of the Sahā World: * Śākyamuni * Avalokiteśvara * Kṣitigarbha ==Summary== The Sahā Triad is a relatively recent development in Buddhist art and is particularly popular in Taiwan. Although largely affiliated with the Tzu Chi Foundation, it has spread among the broader circle of Chinese Buddhism.
